issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Appcelerator Modules
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Modules here.

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
When I try to build my newly created Titanium (1.8.0.1) Android module in Linux it exits with following error. (but in Titanium 1.7.5 it builds perfectly)

ramkumar# ant
Buildfile: build.xml

ndk.build:
     [exec] Android NDK: Your Android application project path contains spaces: '/home/anu-karthik/Titanium Studio Workspace/ramkumar/build/generated'    
     [exec] /home/anu-karthik/android-ndk-r5/build/core/build-local.mk:92: *** Android NDK: Aborting.    .  Stop.
     [exec] Android NDK: The Android NDK build cannot work here. Please move your project to a different location.    

BUILD FAILED
/home/anu-karthik/.titanium/mobilesdk/linux/1.8.0.1/module/android/build.xml:226: exec returned: 2
fields.summary: Not able to create Titanium Android Module for Titanium 1.8.0.1

comments.body:
I had a same problem with 1.8.1 SDK. And I found this would occurs when the module project is located in the path including "space". Probably your studio's workspace might be "Titanium Studio Workspace". Then it includes space. So move your project folder to other directory which is not include the space. Then it works fine.
Good luck!

I have the exact same issue. I can compile fine in 1.7.6 but not 1.8.x and I have no spaces in my path and everything is setup correctly (from what I can see).

Which zip file is it that the build script can't open? Is there anyway I can add some debug print or catch a log?

*Edit*:

I found the problem for my part. When running the ant command and while in the generate.rihno stuff the KrollBindingGenerator tries the following :

JarFile titaniumJar = new JarFile(new File(mobileAndroidDir, "titanium.jar"));

But the "mobileAndroidDir" for some reason points to "/usr/share/ant/lib" (on my linux system, on my mac I think it was somewhere under /share/) and can of course not find the titanium.jar within that path. Can't figure out why the script would think this as it apparently's working for other peeps.

I cloned the titanium_mobile repo and hardcoded (ewww) the path to the titanium.jar for now and of course, it builds.

This bug, as you can see in the log, is in the Google's NDK: Can't work on dirs with spaces. Therefore, you should move your project to a directory without spaces. 

Here is the latest docs for Android Module development: 

https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Android+Module+Development+Guide

Note that there are some changes for 1.8.x SDK for the modules. 

Best,

Mauro
That wasn't the error for me since I don't have any spaces in my setup at least. I did however solve it, but not by a "no space" path.
